1.text: And Elihu will answer and say,

2.text: Didst thou reckon this for judgment thou saidst, My justice is above God?

3.text: For thou wilt say, What shall it profit to thee? what shall I profit from my sin?

4.text: I will turn back words to thee, and thy companions with thee.

5.text: Look upon the heavens and see; behold the clouds, they were high above thee.

6.text: If thou sinnedst, what wilt thou do against him? and thy transgressions were multiplied, what wilt thou do to him?

7.text: If thou wert just, what wilt thou give to him? or what shall he take from thy hand?

8.text: Thy injustice to a man as thou: and thy justice to the son of man.

9.text: From the multitude of oppressions they will cry out: they will cry out from the arm of the many.

10.text: And not saying, Where is God making me? he gave songs in the night.

11.text: And who teacheth us from the cattle of the earth, and he will make us wise above the birds of the heavens?

12.text: Then they will cry, and he will not answer from the face of the pride of the evil.

13.text: Also God will not hear vanity, and the Almighty will not look upon it.

14.text: Also if thou shalt say thou wilt not see him, judgment is before him, and thou shalt wait for him.

15.text: And now that it is not, he reviewed his anger, and he knew not in great transgression.

16.text: And Job will open his mouth in vain; he will bind together words without knowledge.
